conclusion: At t=0, block with mass m is placed on plate with mass M=2m, block has zero initial velocity, plate initially moving with velocity v0.
Forces on block: normal force N from plate, gravitational force mg downward, kinetic frictional force fk=μ1N opposite to direction of relative motion.

Forces on plate: normal force from ground, gravitational force (M+m)g downward, kinetic frictional force between plate and ground fk,ground=μ2(M+m)g, kinetic frictional force from block fk=μ1mg in direction of plate's motion.
Net force on block is kinetic frictional force fk=μ1mg, using Newton's second law: μ1mg=ma_b, a_b=μ1g.
Net force on plate is sum of kinetic frictional forces from ground and block, using Newton's second law: fk,ground-fk=Ma_p, μ2(2m+m)g-μ1mg=2ma_p, a_p=(3μ2g-μ1g)/2.
Relative acceleration between block and plate is a_rel=a_b-a_p, a_rel=μ1g-(3μ2g-μ1g)/2, a_rel=(3μ1g-3μ2g)/2.
From graph, block reaches constant velocity v after some time t, implying relative velocity between block and plate becomes zero.
Given block and plate move together with same velocity, relative acceleration must be zero: (3(μ1-μ2)g)/2=0, μ1-μ2=0, μ1=μ2.
Problem does not provide μ2, assume it is given or can be derived from other conditions.
